brief_summary.textblock:
To investigate whether prolonged period of treatment (6 months) can have a better
      therapeutic outcome than conventional period (3 months) of antimuscarinics.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparisons of 3-month Versus 6-month Solifenacin Treatment for Female OAB Patients

detailed_description.textblock:
Overactive bladder syndrome (OAB), with or without urge incontinence, is characterized by
      urinary urgency, frequency and nocturia. Thus, patients with OAB could be considered to have
      a reduced quality of life. Patients with overactive bladder syndrome have a higher risk of
      falling and fracture due to nocturia. OAB affects around 17 % of female population. At
      present, muscarinic receptor antagonists are the ﬁrst-line pharmacotherapeutic agents for
      OAB. However, discontinuation of the treatment often results in symptom relapse. Until now,
      optimal duration of the treatment and durability of the efﬁcacy have not been determined. We
      plan to use urodynamic studies outcome to evaluate therapeutic effect, with the change of
      urinary nerve growth factor level. This study is a randomized prospective study, comparing
      female OAB patient after 3 months and 6 months of antimuscarinic treatment.

      The purpose of this study is to investigate the difference of urodynamic effects,
      therapeutic effect and urinary  urinary nerve growth factor level between OAB females after
      3 months and 6 months antimuscarinic treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Women who have overactive bladder syndrome

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Women who are less than 20 year-old

intervention.description: Solifenacin 5 mg one a day for 12 weeks
Solifenacin 5 mg once a day for 24 weeks

facility.name: Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology, National Taiwan University Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Comparisons of Urodynamic Effects, Urinary Nerve Growth Factor Levels and Outcomes in Female Overactive Bladder Patients After 3-month Versus 6-month Solifenacin Treatment: a Randomized Prospective Study

primary_outcome.description: The rate of normalized urodynamic finding after antimuscarinics
primary_outcome.measure: The rate of normalized urodynamic findings

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The cure rate of overactive bladder after antimuscarinics
secondary_outcome.measure: The cure rate of overactive bladder

secondary_outcome.description: The recurrence rate of overactive bladder after antimuscarinics
secondary_outcome.measure: The recurrence rate of overactive bladder

secondary_outcome.description: The difference of urine nerve growth factor level after antimuscarinics
secondary_outcome.measure: The difference of urine nerve growth factor level

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
